From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To reload the processor card on the Cisco 7000 series with RSP7000 or Cisco 7500 series routers, use the **microcode reload**command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Reloads the specified processor card slot on a Cisco 7500 series router.

Examples: In the following example, all controllers are reset, and the microcode specified in the current configuration is loaded:
ExtraInfo: This command reloads the microcode without rebooting the router. Immediately after you enter the **microcode reload** command, the system reloads all microcode. Global configuration mode remains enabled.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)If you modify the system configuration to load a microcode image, the **microcodeÂ reload** command will be written to the configuration file automatically following the use of a **microcode** command. This action enables the configured microcode to be downloaded at system startup.---

RelatedCmds.description: Specifies the location from where microcode should be loaded when the **microcode reload** command is processed on RSP-based routers.
